prompts.DailyAnalysis:
# Day Analysis Prompt

Analyze my day and present the results in exactly this format:

## ğŸ“Š Pie Chart-Style Analysis (Text Representation)
Create a visual bar representation using block characters (â–ˆ and â–‘) showing each category with:
- Duration in ~Xh Ym format
- Percentage of total day in parentheses
- Bar length proportional to time spent
- Ordered by duration (longest to shortest)

Format example:
```
ğŸ§  Deep Work â–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–‘â–‘â–‘â–‘â–‘â–‘â–‘â–‘â–‘â–‘ ~4h15m (17.7%)
ğŸ¤ Work Conversations â–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–‘â–‘â–‘â–‘â–‘â–‘â–‘â–‘â–‘â–‘â–‘â–‘â–‘â–‘â–‘ ~2h10m (9.0%)
```

## ğŸ§© Activity Breakdown by Category
Present activities in a clean table format with the following specifications:

**Formatting Requirements:**
- Use consistent emoji icons for each category type
- Order categories by total duration (longest to shortest)
- Include percentage of total day for each category
- Use standardized time format (~Xh Ym for hours/minutes, ~Xm for minutes only)
- Limit highlights to 2-3 key points per category, separated by semicolons
- Use consistent category naming conventions

**Standard Categories (use these when applicable):**
- ğŸ§  Deep Work - focused, productive work tasks
- ğŸ¤ Work Conversations - meetings, discussions, collaboration
- ğŸ› Meals & Socializing - eating, social interactions, personal conversations
- ğŸšƒ Travel & Commute - all transportation and movement
- ğŸ“ Learning & Development - educational content, skill building
- ğŸ¤– Personal Admin - household tasks, personal management, errands
- ğŸ’¤ Rest & Downtime - breaks, relaxation, entertainment
- ğŸƒ Health & Fitness - exercise, health-related activities

**Table Format:**
```
| Category | Duration (% of day) | Highlights |
|----------|---------------------|------------|
| [emoji] [Category Name] | ~[Time] ([X.X%]) | [Key activities; separated by semicolons] |
```

**Additional Instructions:**
- Calculate percentages based on activity of the day (X minutes total from the provided data)
- Round durations to nearest 5-minute increments
- Round percentages to one decimal place
- Order all sections by duration (longest to shortest)
- Use block characters: â–ˆ for filled portions, â–‘ for empty portions
- Bar length should be proportional (approximately 25 characters total width)
- Combine similar activities under appropriate categories
- Ensure all significant time periods (>15 minutes) are accounted for
- Use active, concise language in highlights
- Maintain professional tone while being descriptive

prompts.Weekly_Analysis2:
Enhanced Weekly/Biweekly Report Generation Prompt
Objective
Transform daily notes into a comprehensive structured report covering both professional and personal activities.
Report Structure Requirements
1. Professional Section

Focus: Work projects, meetings, technical tasks, learning, and career development
Details to include:

Specific tools, technologies, or methodologies used
Outcomes, results, or deliverables completed
Challenges encountered and solutions implemented
Key decisions made or insights gained



2. Personal Section

Focus: Family time, hobbies, health/fitness, personal learning, social activities
Details to include:

Activities with family/friends
Personal projects or creative pursuits
Health and wellness activities
Learning or skill development outside of work



3. Reflection & Planning Section

Professional insights: What worked well, what could be improved, upcoming priorities
Personal reflections: Emotional state, life balance observations, personal growth
Action items: Specific next steps for both professional and personal domains

Formatting Guidelines

Date format: Use clear date references (e.g., "June 25 (Tue)")
Emojis: Include one relevant emoji per main point for visual appeal
Grouping: Cluster similar activities or themes together when possible
Length: Keep descriptions detailed but concise (1-2 sentences per entry)
Tone: Professional yet personal, reflective and forward-looking

Content Processing Instructions

Extract and categorize all activities from the daily notes
Prioritize significant events over routine tasks
Identify patterns or themes that emerged during the period
Highlight achievements and meaningful moments
Note any challenges and how they were addressed
Synthesize insights for the reflection section

Example Output Structure
ğŸ“Š Professional Highlights

June 25 (Tue) â€“ ğŸ”§ Finalized ETL scripts for Client A. Used Python and SQL Server to address schema mismatch; ran 3 successful test loads and confirmed field-level accuracy.
June 26 (Wed) â€“ ğŸ“‹ Joined sprint review. Presented dashboard mockups for Rakuten integration project; feedback was positive and will proceed to data layer alignment next week.

ğŸ  Personal Highlights

June 24 (Mon) â€“ ğŸ›’ Family grocery run and cleaned the kitchen together. Also finalized daycare application documents.
June 29 (Sat) â€“ ğŸ® Took son to the park; observed his language mixing Chinese and Japanese â€” started brainstorming a trilingual flashcard game to help support him.

ğŸ¯ Reflection & Next Steps
Professional: Made solid progress across data validation, dashboard design, and ops troubleshooting. Next week: focus on performance optimization and user stories refinement.
Personal: Felt more mindful of family quality time and creative parenting. Want to allocate one evening this week to app prototyping.
Process improvement: Consider journaling each day's top 1 takeaway to help future reports flow more easily.

Daily Notes to Process:
prompts.daily_Suggest: My goal is to be better on every dimension of my life: personal, work, and family. Give me one concrete thing I could do to be better using these conversations by focusing on what I said and how I responded to the people in my life. Support this one concrete way I can be better with several examples to help me identify patterns I might not realize. Be candid
prompts.daily_Summary:
I need a summary of my day based on my conversation transcripts from yesterday. Look at the transcript and respond with a summary of my day that I can use to review everything that happened quickly.
Here are the things I want to be included in the summary:
- Key meetings and conversations I participated in
- Important information I learned or shared
- Decisions I made or was involved in
- Problems I encountered and solutions I found
- Major themes or patterns in my conversations

Format the summary to be readable and insightful, highlighting what matters most about my day. Keep it brief but comprehensive, capturing the essence of my experiences rather than listing every detail.
Show me the summary in chronological order when possible, starting with morning activities and ending with evening ones. Prioritize significant events over routine interactions.
prompts.daily_Todo:
I need a comprehensive to-do list based on my conversation transcripts. Please analyze the transcript and identify all tasks, commitments, and follow-up actions I mentioned or agreed to.
Importantly: Only use items that I specifically said I would do. Do not include things other people said they would do.
For each item, include enough detail that I can understand what needs to be done without having to review the entire transcript again. Use action verbs at the beginning of each task.
Group related tasks together when possible, and highlight any dependencies between tasks (e.g., "Complete X before starting Y").
Exclude routine activities or general comments that don't require specific action.

prompts.weeklyReport:

ğŸ§­ Reflection & Next Steps

Personally, felt more mindful of family quality time and creative parenting. Want to allocate one evening this week to app prototyping.

Consider journaling each dayâ€™s top 1 takeaway to help future reports flow more easily.
prompts.proofread: I want you act as a proofreader. I will provide you texts and I would like you to review them for any spelling, grammar, or punctuation errors. Once you have finished reviewing the text, provide me with any necessary corrections or suggestions for improve the text.
